required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study Evaluating the Effects of Multiple Oral Doses of ERB-041 on Cardiac Repolarization in Healthy Subjects
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo and Moxifloxacin (Open-Label) Controlled, 4-Period, Crossover Study of the Effects of Multiple Oral Doses of ERB-041 on Cardiac Repolarization in Healthy Subjects

lead_sponsor.agency: Wyeth is now a wholly owned subsidiary of Pfizer

clinical_study.source: Wyeth is now a wholly owned subsidiary of Pfizer

brief_summary.textblock: To assess the effect of ERB-041 after multiple oral doses on cardiac repolarization as assessed by the QTc interval.

primary_outcome.measure: To assess the effect of ERB-041 after multiple oral doses on cardiac repolarization as assessed by the QTc interval

secondary_outcome.measure: To characterize pharmacokinetic and pharmacodynamic relationships as it relates to QTc.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy as determined by the investigator on the basis of medical history, physical examination, clinical laboratory test results, vital signs, and ECG.
- Nonsmoker or smoker of fewer than 10 cigarettes (half a pack) per day as determined by history.
Exclusion Criteria:
- A family history of long QT syndrome and/or cardiac death.
- Any significant cardiovascular, hepatic, renal, respiratory, gastrointestinal, endocrine, immunologic, dermatologic, hematological, neurological, or psychiatric disease.

overall_official.affiliation: Wyeth is now a wholly owned subsidiary of Pfizer
